revisions.rev: {{Infobox filesystem| | name = SquashFS | developer = Phillip Lougher, Robert Lougher | full_name = | introduction_date = 2009 | introduction_os = Linux 2.6.29 | partition_id = | directory_struct = | file_struct = | bad_blocks_struct = | max_file_size = 16 [[Exbibyte|EiB]] | max_files_no = | max_filename_size = | max_volume_size = 16 [[Exbibyte|EiB]] | dates_recorded = | date_range = | date_resolution = | forks_streams = | attributes = | file_system_permissions = | compression = [[gzip]] [[LZMA]] [[LZO]] [[xz]] | encryption = | OS = [[Linux]] }} '''SquashFS (.sfs)''' is a [[Data compression|compressed]] [[File system permissions|read-only]] [[file system]] for [[Linux (kernel)|Linux]]. SquashFS compresses [[Computer file|files]], [[inode]]s and [[directory (file systems)|directories]], and supports [[block (data storage)|block]] sizes up to 1 [[Megabyte|MB]] for greater compression. SquashFS is also the name of [[free software|free/open]] [[software]], licensed under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]], for accessing SquashFS filesystems. SquashFS is intended for general read-only file system use and in constrained [[block size (data storage and transmission)|block device]]/[[memory system]]s (e.g. [[embedded system]]s) where low overhead is needed. The original version of SquashFS used [[gzip]] compression, although Linux kernel 2.6.34 added support for [[LZMA]][http://www.squashfs-lzma.org/ Why Squashfs LZMA?] and [[LZO]] compression[http://kernelnewbies.org/Linux_2_6_34#head-35808ff36eeaca6084c79975a7d50263b726acc1 Linux 2.6.34 - Linux Kernel Newbies], and Linux kernel 2.6.38 added support for [[xz]] compression.[http://kernelnewbies.org/Linux_2_6_38#head-1ca50229f5801418cffa063f800aae8b466f1c60 Linux 2.6.38 - Linux Kernel Newbies] Linux kernel 2.6.35 added support for [[Extended file attributes]].[http://kernelnewbies.org/Linux_2_6_35#head-7b60ef60876830625c37e8f1c24e460eebc418cc Linux 2 6 35 - Linux Kernel Newbies] ==Uses== SquashFS is used by the [[Live CD]] versions of [[Arch Linux]], [[Debian]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], [[Gentoo Linux]], [[Salix_OS|Salix]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] and on embedded distributions such as the [[OpenWrt]]http://wiki.openwrt.org/doc/techref/flash.layout#partitioning.of.squashfs-images and [[DD-WRT]] [[router (computing)|router]] [[firmware]]. It is often combined with a [[union mount]] filesystem, such as [[UnionFS]] or [[aufs]], to provide a read-write environment for live Linux distributions. This takes advantage of both the SquashFS's high speed compression abilities and the ability to alter the distribution while running it from a live CD. Distributions such as [[Debian Live]], [[Mandriva One]], [[Puppy Linux]], [[Salix_OS#LiveCD_Version|Salix Live]] and [[Slax]] use this combination. The on-disk format of SquashFS has stabilized enough that it has been merged into the 2.6.29 version of the [[Linux kernel]].[http://www.heise-online.co.uk/open/Btrfs-and-Squashfs-merged-into-Linux-kernel--/news/112389 Btrfs and Squashfs merged into Linux kernel] Jan 10, 2009 In that process, the backward-compatibility code for older formats was removed.[http://linux.derkeiler.com/Mailing-Lists/Kernel/2009-01/msg05708.html Re: BUG? SQUASHFS error: Major/Minor mismatch] Tue, January 13, 2009 SquashFS is also used by [[Linux Terminal Server Project]], [[Slax]], and [[Splashtop]]. The SquashFS files might use extension .sqx also used for [[SQX]]. The tools ''unsquashfs'' and ''mksquashfs'' have been ported to [[Windows NT]],{{cite web |url=http://www.tomas-m.com/blog/482-Squashfs-tools-for-Windows.html |title=Squashfs tools for Windows |work=tomas-m.com [[Slax]] blog |year=2009 |accessdate=2011-07-23}} read access is also possible with [[7-zip]]. ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Comparison of file systems]] * [[List of file systems]] * [[Cloop]] is a compressed loopback device module for the [[Linux kernel]] * [[Cramfs]] is another read-only compressed file system * [[e2compr]] provides compression for [[ext2]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://squashfs.sourceforge.net/ SquashFS website], squashfs.sourceforge.net {{Filesystem}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Squashfs}} [[Category:Free special purpose file systems]] [[Category:Compression file systems]] [[Category:Linux file systems]] [[de:SquashFS]] [[es:SquashFS]] [[fr:SquashFS]] [[it:SquashFS]] [[ja:SquashFS]] [[pl:SquashFS]] [[pt:SquashFS]] [[ru:Squashfs]] [[zh:SquashFS]] {{linux-stub}}
